page.title: 05OUR VILLAGE AT NIGHT-POEM
page.content: It's night time, and the village closes it's eyes The lights go off one by one And sleep has settled in. The fresh smell of the countryside mingles with the air. It is still and lonely. Cows mooing in the night, giving a last, long lonesome moo. Spiky hedgehogs rustling in the leaves, scuttling across the road, risking their lives for food. Foxes stalking their prey, stealing from the farm And dogs howling through the darkness. The trees sway in the breeze, and leaves rustle in the branches. Voices echo through the night Silhouettes of trees, houses and hills, black against the night. The moon and stars shine in the sky, While children sleep in their beds.
